intro: Galium intermedium, commonly known as common bedstraw, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, creeping stems and opposite, oval-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, white or pinkish flowers in clusters during the summer months. Its leaves and stems are often covered in fine, silky hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. Galium intermedium is commonly found in moist meadows, woodlands, and along stream banks.
